shortcontents.shortcontent: The Ms. contains the following text: I) Liturgical miscellanea (fols.1r-17r): I-1) Unidentified passage from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (?) (fols. 1r - 1v l.2/3) I-2) Prayer of the Father (fol. 1v ls.2/4-10/2): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Śәrʿatä qәddase, ch. II, § 61 [ls.22-30]) I-3) Thanksgiving Prayer of St. Basil (fols. 1v l.10/3 - 2r l.8/1): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Śәrʿatä qәddase, ch. III, § 35) I-4) Prayer of oblation (fol. 2r ls.8/2-12): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Śәrʿatä qәddase, ch. III, §§ 42-43) I-5) Unidentified passage from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (?) (fol. 2v ls.1-6/1) I-6) Fәtḥat zä-wäld “Absolution of the Son” (fols. 2v l.6/2 - 7v l.5/2): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Śәrʿatä qәddase, ch. III, §§ 66-98) I-7) Prayer after the Body and the Blood have been consumed (from the Liturgy of the Eucharist) (fols. 7v l.5/3 - 8r l.7): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Qәddase zä-ḥawaryat, §§ 148-149) I-8) Concluding chant after the reading from the Pauline Epistles (from the Liturgy of the Word) (fols. 8r l.8 - 8v l.8): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Śәrʿatä qәddase, ch. III, § 136) I-9) Unidentified passage from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (?) (fol. 8v ls.9-13/1) I-10) Prayer of the Gospel (from the Liturgy of the Word) (fols. 8v l.13/2 - 9r l.3/1): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Śәrʿatä qәddase, ch. III, § 189) I-11) (fol. 9r ls.3/2-9/1): unidentified passage from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (?) I-12) Supplication for peace, the hierarchy and the assembly (from the Liturgy of the Eucharist) (fols. 9r l.9/2 - 9v l.7/2): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Śәrʿatä qәddase, ch. IV, §§ 8, 17) I-13) Prayer of faith (from the liturgy of the Eucharist) (fols. 9v l.7/3 - 10r l.2): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Śәrʿatä qәddase, ch. IV, § 38) I-14) Prayer of salutation of St. Basil (from the liturgy of the Eucharist) (fols. 10r ls.3-11/1): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Śәrʿatä qәddase, ch. IV, §§ 58-59) I-15) Prayer for the sake of ... (from the Liturgy of the Eucharist) (fols. 10r l.11/2 - 11v l.4/2): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Qәddase zä-ḥawaryat, §§ 6-9) I-16) Prayer from the book of the “Kidan” (from the Liturgy of the Eucharist) (fols. 11v l.4/3 - 12v l.11/3): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Qәddase zä-ʾƎgziʾ, §§ 2-13) I-17) Prayer for the sake of ... (from the Liturgy of the Eucharist) (fols. 12v l.11/4 - 14v l.3/3): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Qәddase zä-Maryam, §§ 11-15) I-18) Prayer of the benediction (from the Liturgy of the Eucharist) (fol. 14v ls.3/4-6): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Qәddase, zä-Yoḥannǝs Wäldä Nägwädgwad, § 102) I-19) Prayer of the penitence (from the Liturgy of the Eucharist) (fol. 14v ls.7-8): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Qәddase, zä-Yoḥannǝs wäldä Nägwädgwad, §§ 125) I-20) Prayer of fraction (from the Liturgy of the Eucharist) (fol. 14v ls.9-11): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Qәddase, zä-Yoḥannǝs wäldä Nägwädgwad, §§ 117, 121) I-21) (fols. 15r - 15v l.3/1): unidentified passage from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (?) I-22) Prayer of Basil (from the Liturgy of the Eucharist) (fols. 15v ls.3/2 - 16r l.3): excerpts from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (MQ, Qәddase zä-ḥawaryat, §§ 125 [5-8], 130, 132, 134) I-23) Unidentified passage from the Maṣḥafä qәddase (?) (fols. 16r l.4 - 17r l.6)

copyists.copyist: Wäldä Muse is mentioned as the scribe in the supplication formula, fol. 17r, l.9. However, the handwriting appears to be dissimilar from that of the scribe Wäldä Muse attested in some other manuscripts (e.g., SMM-004, UM-023, MR-016 etc.); but it appear similar to Ms. SMM-006.

dcomments.dcomment: Mention of Metropolitan ʾAtnatewos (in tenure 1869-76), on fol. 9v (ls.4-5), and King Yoḥannǝs IV (r. 1872-89), on fol. 5r (ls.8-9).

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is worn. Both boards and original sewing are missing. Holes on fols. 16 and 17. Fol. 7 is a loose leaf.

squires.squire: The original structure of the quires cannot be established due to the poor condition of the Ms. It can be assumed as follows: I(6/fols. 1r-6v) – II(1/fols. 7r-7v) – III(6/fols. 8r-13v) – IV(4/fols. 14r-17v).

taunit.ln-info: The number of lines is not constant: it changes between 11 and 12. Fol. 15r has 16 lines.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/A. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written below the ruling (above on fols. 3r, 5r, 7r, 17r). The bottom line is written above the ruling (below on fol. 3v).

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The broadly spaced handwriting is characterized by thin and tall letters, slightly slanted to the right. - The loops of ግ and ቆ are in many cases very pronounced. - The top of some letters is sometimes extends beyond the headline: cp. ቶ on fols. 2v l.9, 14r l.1; ት on fol. 7v l.1; ግ e.g., fols. 8v, l.8, 9v, l.1 fol. 19v l.5. - The vowel marker of ይ has a hook shape, particularly rounded and curved (e.g., fols. 2v l.10, 3r, ls. 4 and 9). - The word እግዚአብሔር is usually written with ligature (ግ and ዚ, e.g., fols. 2v l.8, 7v l.3).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; the name of Metropolitan ʾAtänatewos (fol. 9v ls.4-5) and of King Yoḥannǝs (fol. 5r ls.8-9); elements of punctuation signs and of Ethiopic numerals. The Trinitarian formula in the incipit page of the text (fol. 1r) and the initial words of its subsections.

otherdetails.otherdetail:
The text is compared to the printed edition Mäṣḥafä Qǝddase. Bä-gǝˤǝzna bä-ʾamarǝñña, Addis Abäba 1962 A.M. [1970 A.D.]. The subsections composing it are listed above (s. “Short content") as follows: for the fols. and lines of the texts in the Ms. it is given the correspondent texts of the printed version of the Mäṣḥafä Qǝddase with, in sequence, the name of the section, the chapter (ch.), the paragraph (§), the lines from the beginning of the paragraph and a word from the beginning of the line.
- Text I-16 is incomplete at the end (fol. 14v). - The text ends with a subscriptio (fol. 17r ls.7-9) containing a poorly legible supplication formula, mentioning in the end Wäldä Muse. His name is also present in several other Mss. preserved in the church of Mǝdrä Ruba, but in Ms. MR-006 he is not explicitly referred to as the scribe, and the scribal hand is slightly different from that of Wäldä Muse as attested in other Mss. The subscriptio is separated from the main text by a chain of red and black dots. - A chain of four dot asterisks in red (?) and in black, followed by two chains of red and black dots with in middle a chain of red dots, decorates the upper margin of the incipit page (fol. 1r). The last text (I-18) is separated by the previous one by two chains of black dots. A particular punctuation sign is on fol. 11v l.4; it consists of five nine dot asterisks in a shape of a cross. - Fol. 15r appears in a different layout containing a greater number of written lines (16). - The structure of the Ms. is similar to that of Mäṣḥafä nǝfq “The Book of the Assistant Priest” (s. Mss. AGM-009, MR-004, QSM-028, SMM-006).

extras.extra: A crude note in pen is below the text on fol. 17r.
